duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with families, teachers, and team members to create and implement individualized learning plans.
Determine research-based interventions and progress monitoring tools.
Provide individualized instruction in math and English Language Arts.
Analyze ongoing progress monitoring data and make instructional decisions.
Employ a variety of instructional techniques consistent with student needs.
Model strategies for independent implementation by students.
Participate in training and staff development.
Maintain a positive and professional relationship with colleagues, students, families, and community members.
Encourage physical, emotional, and social growth in all students.
Serve as a role model in personal language, appearance, and professionalism.
Increase cultural competence and promote diversity, equity, and inclusion.
Maintain positive relationships with children, parents, and other staff.
Serve students with a wide variety of abilities and disabilities in an inclusive setting.
Maintain confidentiality with respect to staff or family issues.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or higher in early childhood, elementary, and/or special education.
